page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Rhos is situated on the lower slopes of Ruabon mountain and the western side of the block area rises to a height of 600ft and is mainly rural used for sheep farming.To the east of Rhos the land descends gently to the height of 325ft with the village of Johnstown situted along the trunk road A483 linking Chirk to Chester.Services in Rhos include small supermarkets and other tertiary industries while other villages have their own small shops.The area developed through its association with the coal mining,being situated on the north wales coal field.The last pit was closed in 1968 and much of the land to the east of the block is coal spoil heaps(Hafod).Small light industries have developed in Rhos and along the 483 in Johnstown.The majority of people leave the area to work.
